intro: Actinobole drummondiana, commonly known as the Drummond's actinobole, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant produces woody capsules as fruit, which contain numerous seeds. It is often found in sandy soils in heathlands and is adapted to the dry, coastal environments of its native range. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
